template.template: Template Windows 2012 R2 IIS Servers NODE
template.name: Template Windows 2012 R2 IIS Servers NODE

item.name: Windows Application Error (IIS configuration change)
IIS-W3SVC degradation
Windows 2012 R2 IIS Port 80HTTP
Windows 2012 R2 IIS Port 443HTTPS
Windows 2012 R2 IIS ASP.NET Application Restarts
item.description:
The number of application restarts. Recreating the application domain and recompiling pages takes time, therefore unforeseen application restarts should be investigated.
Threshold: 0. In a perfect world, the application domain will survive for the life of the process. Excessive values should be investigated, and a new threshold should be set as necessary.

item.name: Windows 2012 R2 IIS ASP.NET Requests Rejected
item.description:
The number of rejected requests. Requests are rejected when one of the queue limits is exceeded (see description of Requests Queued). Requests can be rejected for a number of reasons. Backend latency, such as that caused by a slow SQL server, is often preceded by a sudden increase in the number of pipeline instances and a decrease in CPU utilization and Requests/sec. A server may be overwhelmed during times of heavy load due to processor or memory constraints that ultimately result in the rejection of requests.
Threshold: 0. The value of this counter should be 0. Values greater than this should be investigated.

item.name: Windows 2012 R2 IIS ASP.NET Request Wait Time
item.description:
The number of milliseconds that the most recent request spent waiting in the queue, or named pipe, that exists between inetinfo and aspnet_wp (see description of Requests Queued). This does not include any time spent waiting in the application queues.
Threshold: 1000. The average request should spend 0 milliseconds waiting in the queue.

item.name: Windows 2012 R2 IIS ASP.NET Worker Processes Running
item.description:
The current number of aspnet_wp worker processes. For a short period of time, a new worker process and the worker process that is being replaced may coexist. Although rare, sometimes processes deadlock while they are exiting. If you suspect this, consider using a tool to monitor the number of instances of the worker process. Alternatively, the Memory\Available Mbytes performance counter can be used, since these hanging processes will consume memory.
Threshold: 2. During shutdown of the previous worker process, there may be two instances. If webGarden is enabled, the threshold should be #CPUs plus 1. Values greater than this may indicate excessive process restarts within a very short period of time.

item.name: Windows 2012 R2 IIS ASP.NET Worker Process Restarts
item.description:
The number of aspnet_wp process restarts.
Threshold: 1. Process restarts are expensive and undesirable.

item.name: IIS Processor Time
item.description: Metric Process % Processor Time of IIS perf_counter[\Process(w3wp)\% Processor Time]

item.name: Windows 2012 R2 IIS Web Service(_Total) % 500 HTTP Response Send
item.description: Any requests with a 500 status code are internal server errors

item.name: Windows 2012 R2 IIS Web Service(_Total) Bytes Received/sec
item.description: Rate of total bytes transferred by service (received)

item.name: Windows 2012 R2 IIS Web Service(_Total) Bytes Sent/sec
item.description: Rate of total bytes transferred by service (sent)

item.name: Windows 2012 R2 IIS Web Service(_Total) Bytes Total/sec
item.description: Rate of total bytes transferred by service (sum of bytes sent and received)

item.name: Windows 2012 R2 IIS Web Service(_Total) Connection Attempts/sec
Windows 2012 R2 IIS Web Service(_Total) Current Connections
item.description: Current number of connections to the service

item.name: Windows 2012 R2 IIS Web Service(_Total) Get Requests/sec
item.description: Total number of HTTP GET requests received by WWW service

item.name: Windows 2012 R2 IIS Web Service(_Total) Logon Attempts/sec
Windows 2012 R2 IIS Web Service(_Total) Not Found Errors/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which requests were not satisfied by the server because the requested document was not found.

item.name: Windows 2012 R2 IIS Web Service(_Total) Post Requests/sec
item.description: Number of HTTP requests using POST method

item.name: Windows 2012 R2 IIS Web Service Cache Current Files Cached
item.description: Current number of files whose content is in the user-mode cache

item.name: Windows 2012 R2 IIS Web Service Cache Current Metadata Cached
item.description: Current number of metadata information blocks currently in the user-mode cache.

item.name: Windows 2012 R2 IIS Web Service Cache Current URIs Cached
item.description: URI information blocks currently in the user-mode cache

item.name: Windows 2012 R2 IIS Web Service Cache File Cache Hits %
item.description: The ratio of user-mode file cache hits to total cache requests (since service startup). Note: This value might be low if the Kernel URI cache hits percentage is high.

item.name: Windows 2012 R2 IIS Web Service Cache Metadata Cache Hits
item.description: The ratio of user-mode metadata cache hits to total cache requests (since service startup)

item.name: Windows 2012 R2 IIS Web Service Cache URI Cache Hits %
item.description: The ratio of user-mode URI Cache Hits to total cache requests (since service startup)

item.name: IIS WP Count
IIS WP Memory Total KB
Windows 2012 R2 IIS Service IIS World Side Web Publishing
item.description: World Wide Web Publishing Service

item.name: IIS WP Memory Total

trigger.expression: {Template Windows 2012 R2 IIS Servers NODE:eventlog[Application,,Error,,^2307$|^2297$].logeventid(2307)}=1 and {Template Windows 2012 R2 IIS Servers NODE:eventlog[Application,,Error,,^2307$|^2297$].logseverity(0)}>1 and {Template Windows 2012 R2 IIS Servers NODE:eventlog[Application,,Error,,^2307$|^2297$].nodata(300)}=0
trigger.name: IIS degradation on {HOST.NAME}.

dependency.name: Service IIS World Wide Web Publishing
Service IIS World Wide Web Publishing

trigger.expression: {Template Windows 2012 R2 IIS Servers NODE:perf_counter[\Processor(_Total)\% Processor Time].min(#5)}>70
trigger.name: Processor load is too high on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Windows 2012 R2 IIS Servers NODE:perf_counter["\ASP.NET v4.0.30319\Request Wait Time",60].last()}>1000
trigger.name: Request Wait Time on {HOST.NAME}
Service IIS World Wide Web Publishing

trigger.expression: {Template Windows 2012 R2 IIS Servers NODE:eventlog[Application,,"Error",,^0$].logseverity(0)}>1 and {Template Windows 2012 R2 IIS Servers NODE:eventlog[Application,,"Error",,^0$].nodata(300)}=0 and {Template Windows 2012 R2 IIS Servers NODE:eventlog[Application,,"Error",,^0$].str("_shutDownMessage=IIS configuration change")}=1
trigger.name: Windows Application Error (IIS configuration change) on {HOST.NAME}.

trigger.expression: {Template Windows 2012 R2 IIS Servers NODE:perf_counter["\ASP.NET v4.0.30319\Worker Processes Running",60].last()}>2
trigger.name: Worker Processes Running on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Windows 2012 R2 IIS Servers NODE:perf_counter["\ASP.NET v4.0.30319\Worker Process Restarts",60].last()}>=1
trigger.name: Worker Process Restarts on {HOST.NAME}
